intro: Lipochaeta longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in coastal areas. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months. Lipochaeta longipes is often found in coastal heathlands and is adapted to withstand salty and windy conditions.
